main_definition: In the context of card games, an 'ace' is a playing card that often has significant value depending on its position in hand; also used informally to describe someone who excels at a particular skill or activity.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A playing card with high rank
meanings_and_examples.example: In poker, an ace is typically the highest-ranking card in its suit.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Someone who excels at a skill or activity
meanings_and_examples.example: She's such an ace player; she won every match this season.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An individual member of the suits in playing cards (ace, king, queen, jack)
meanings_and_examples.example: The ace of hearts is part of my favorite suit and card combination.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A term used informally to describe a person who performs exceptionally well
meanings_and_examples.example: He's an ace at solving complex mathematical problems; he always gets the right answer quickly.
